<tr>
<td width="45%" valign="bottom" style="width:45.46%;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in">
<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-

subsidiaries:</font></font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:
10.0pt">Through consolidation, we have eliminated all significant intercompany
accounts and transactions.</font></font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:
10.0pt">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:
10.0pt">We have prepared the unaudited financial statements presented herein in
accordance with the instructions to Form 10-Q.&#160;
The statements do not include all the information and note disclosures
required by generally accepted accounting principles for complete financial
statements.&#160; Please read the interim
consolidated financial statements in conjunction with the Consolidated
Financial Statements and attached notes for the year ended December 31, 2000,
included in the Company&#146;s Annual Report on Form 10-K, as filed with the
Securities and Exchange Commission.&#160; In
the opinion of management, we have made all necessary adjustments for a fair
statement of the results for the unaudited interim periods.&#160; These are only
normal recurring adjustments.</font></font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:.25in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New 
Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<p align="left" style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;text-
align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-
size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman'">We
base the effective corporate tax rate for interim periods on the estimated
annual effective corporate tax rate, excluding certain nonrecurring or unusual
events.&#160; The effective tax rate varies
from statutory rates primarily due to the tax effect of the Canadian
acquisition (discussed in Note 2), tax credits and Canadian resource 
allowance.</font></font></p>
<p align="left" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;text-align:left;"><font size="2" 
face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:
10.0pt">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:
10.0pt">The functional currency of MarkWest is the dollar, except for its
Canadian operations that use the Canadian dollar.&#160; Assets and liabilities 
of the Canadian operations are translated
at the spot rate in effect at the applicable reporting date, and the income
statement accounts are translated at the average exchange rates in effect
during the applicable period.&#160; The
resulting cumulative translation adjustment is recorded as a component of
accumulated other comprehensive income.</font></font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:
10.0pt">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:
10.0pt">We have reclassified certain prior-year amounts to conform to the
current year&#146;s presentation.</font></font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:
10.0pt">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold">NOTE
2.&#160; ACQUISITION</font></font></b></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:
10.0pt">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:
10.0pt">On August 10, 2001, MarkWest acquired for $50 million 100 percent of
the voting shares of Leland Energy Canada, Ltd. and Watford Energy, Ltd. 
(&#147;Leland/Watford&#148;),
two privately owned natural gas production companies active in central and
southeast Alberta, Canada.&#160;&#160; The
management of these companies has continued with MarkWest. The acquisition
included 26 Bcfe of proved reserves (95 percent natural gas), 106,000 net
acres, and an inventory of 300 drillable locations.&#160; The properties feature
low-cost, shallow drilling for multiple
pay horizons, with year-round drilling access.&#160;
MarkWest is supplementing this acquisition with a midstream investment
in gathering and compression facilities in the area.</font></font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:
10.0pt">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:
10.0pt">The purchase price was allocated as follows (in 
thousands):</font></font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:
10.0pt">&nbsp;</font></font></p>

</table>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:
10.0pt">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:
10.0pt">In addition to the $50 million acquisition cost identified above, we
recorded a deferred income tax liability of $31 million to recognize the
difference between the historical tax basis of the Leland/Watford assets and
the acquisition costs recorded for book purposes.&#160; The recorded book value 
of the oil and gas properties was
increased to recognize this tax basis differential.</font></font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:
10.0pt">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:
'Times New Roman';"><br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always">
</font></font>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:
10.0pt">MarkWest has entered into employment contracts with certain executives
from Leland/Watford that provide for a minimum annual salary and incentives
based on increases in reserve value, as defined, since the acquisition.&#160; 
The executives&#146; entitlement to these
incentives vests over time through December 31, 2005, and are payable in cash
or in kind by way of transferring to the executives a working interest in the
acquired assets.</font></font></p>
<p align="left" style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;text-
align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-
size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman'">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<p align="left" style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;text-
align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-
size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman'">Pro
Forma Results of Operations (Unaudited)</font></font></p>
<p align="left" style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-

align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-

<p align="left" style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-

align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-
size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman'">The
following table reflects the unaudited pro forma consolidated results of
operations for the nine months ended September 30, 2001 and 2000 as though the
Canadian acquisitions had occurred on January 1<sup>st</sup> for the periods
presented.&#160; These unaudited pro forma
results have been prepared for comparative purposes only and are not indicative
of future results.</font></font></p>

</table>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:
10.0pt">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:
10.0pt">Proforma net income included a bonus expense of $2.8 million and a gain
on settlement of derivatives of $1.1 million for the nine months ended
September 30, 2001.&#160; Proforma net income
included a gain on sale of a partnership of $4.3 million for the nine months
ended September 30, 2000..</font></font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:
10.0pt">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<p align="left" style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;text-
align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-
size:10.0pt;
font-family:'Times New Roman';font-weight:bold">NOTE 3.&#160; LONG TERM 
DEBT</font></font></b></p>
<p align="left" style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;text-
align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-
size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman'">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<p align="left" style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;text-
align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-
size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman'">In
conjunction with the Canadian acquisition (see Note 2), effective August 10,
2001, we amended our credit agreement with various financial institutions.&#160;
The amended agreement provides for a $65
million increase to our maximum borrowing amount, now $130 million.&#160; The 
amended agreement is comprised of a $90
million revolving line of credit and a term loan of $40 million.&#160; The terms
of the loans extend to August
2005.&#160; Actual borrowing limits may be a
lesser amount, depending upon trailing cash flow, as defined in the
agreement.&#160; All other aspects of the
amended credit agreement, including rates, collateralization and restrictions
are similar to the prior agreement.</font></font></p>
<p align="left" style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;text-
align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-
size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman'">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:
10.0pt">Effective October 12, 2001, we amended our credit agreement to replace
$35 million of the existing $90 million revolving line of credit with a
Canadian credit facility for the same amount.&#160;
Our combined maximum borrowing amount remains at $130 million.&#160; The term of
this $35 million revolving line
of credit extends through October 2007.&#160;
All other aspects of the amended credit agreement, including rates,
collateralization and restrictions are similar to the prior 
agreement.</font></font></p>
<p align="left" style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;text-
align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-
size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman'">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<h4 style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
left:0in;margin-right:-.25pt;margin-top:0in;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times
New Roman'">NOTE 4.&#160; RECENT ACCOUNTING 
PRONOUNCEMENTS</font></font></b></h4>
<h4 style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
left:0in;margin-right:-.25pt;margin-top:0in;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times
New Roman'">&nbsp;</font></font></b></h4>
<h4 style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
left:0in;margin-right:-.25pt;margin-top:0in;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times
New Roman';
font-weight:normal">In June 1998, the Financial Accounting Standards Board
(&#147;FASB&#148;) issued Statement of Financial Accounting Standards 
(&#147;SFAS&#148;) No. 133, <i><font style="font-style:italic">Accounting
for Derivative Instruments and Hedging Activities.&#160; </font></i>This 
statement, as amended by SFAS Nos. 137 and 138,
is effective for fiscal years beginning after June 15, 2000.&#160; SFAS No. 133 
requires an entity to recognize
all derivatives as assets or liabilities in the balance sheet and measure those
instruments at fair value.&#160; MarkWest has
adopted SFAS No. 133, as amended, on January 1, 2001.&#160; See Note 7 Adoption 
of SFAS No. 133.</font></font></b></h4>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:
10.0pt">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:
10.0pt">In June 2001, the FASB issued SFAS No. 141, <i><font style="font-
style:italic">Business Combinations</font></i>, which
addresses financial accounting and reporting for business combinations.&#160; 
SFAS No. 141 is effective for all business
combinations initiated after June 30, 2001 and for all business combinations
accounted for under the purchase method initiated before but completed after
June 30, 2001.&#160; All business
combinations in the scope of this Statement are to be accounted for using one
method &#150; the purchase method.&#160; The
adoption of SFAS No. 141 did not have a material impact on the Company&#146;s
financial position or results of operations.</font></font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:
10.0pt">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:
10.0pt">In June 2001, the FASB issued SFAS No. 142, <i><font style="font-
style:italic">Goodwill and Other Intangible</font></i>
<i><font style="font-style:italic">Assets</font></i>,
which is effective for fiscal years beginning after December 15, 2001, and
applies to all goodwill and other intangibles recognized in the financial
statements at that date.&#160; Under the
provisions of this statement, goodwill will not be amortized, but will be
tested for impairment on an annual basis.&#160;
The adoption of SFAS No. 142 is not expected to have a material impact
on the Company&#146;s financial position or results of 
operations.</font></font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:
10.0pt">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:
'Times New Roman';"><br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always">
</font></font>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:
10.0pt">In July 2001, the FASB issued Statement of Financial Accounting
Standards No. 143, <i><font style="font-style:italic">Accounting for Asset 
Retirement Obligations</font></i>
(&#147;SFAS 143&#148;).&#160; SFAS 143, is effective
for fiscal years beginning after June 15, 2002 (January&nbsp;1, 2003 for
MarkWest), and establishes an accounting standard requiring the recording of
the fair value of liabilities associated with the retirement of long-lived
assets in the period in which they are incurred.&#160; We are in the process of 
determining the future impact that the
adoption of FAS 143 may have on our earnings and financial 
position.</font></font></p>
<h4 style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
left:0in;margin-right:-.25pt;margin-top:0in;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times
New Roman'">&nbsp;</font></font></b></h4>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:
10.0pt">In August 2001, the FASB issued SFAS No. 144, <i><font style="font-
style:italic">Accounting for the Impairment or
Disposal of Long-Lived Assets.</font></i>&#160;
This statement requires the recognition of an impairment loss if the
carrying amount of a long-lived asset is not recoverable from its undiscounted
cash flows and measures the impairment loss as the difference between the
carrying amount and fair value of the asset.&#160;
The adoption of SFAS No. 144 is not expected to have a material impact
on the Company&#146;s financial position or results of 
operations.</font></font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:
10.0pt">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<h4 style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
left:0in;margin-right:-.25pt;margin-top:0in;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times
New Roman'">NOTE 5.&#160;&#160; SEGMENT REPORTING</font></font></b></h4>
<h1 align="left" style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;font-
style:italic;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-
top:0in;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" 
face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New 
Roman'">&nbsp;</font></font></i></b></h1>
<p align="left" style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;text-
align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-
size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman'">We
classify MarkWest&#146;s operations into two reportable segments, as 
follows:</font></font></p>
<p align="left" style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;text-
align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-
size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman'">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<p align="left" style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:.75in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;text-
align:left;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman'">(1)&#160;&#160; 
Gathering, Processing and Marketing
(&#147;GPM&#148;)&#151;provide compression, gathering, treatment, NGL extraction
and
fractionation services; also purchase and market natural gas and NGLs; 
and</font></font></p>
<p align="left" style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:.5in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;text-
align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:
10.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman'">(2)&#160;&#160; Exploration
and Production (&#147;E &amp; P&#148;)&#151;explore for and produce natural 
gas.</font></font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:
10.0pt">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<p align="left" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;text-align:left;"><font size="2" 
face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt">We evaluate the 
performance of our segments and
allocate resources to them based on operating income. There are no intersegment
revenues.&#160; We conduct our business in
the United States and Canada.</font></font></p>
<p align="left" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;text-align:left;"><font size="2" 
face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<p align="left" style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;page-break-
after:avoid;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman'">The
table below presents information about operating income for the reported
segments for the second quarter of 2001 and 2000 and for the nine months ended
September 30, 2001 and 2000.&#160; Operating
income for each segment includes total revenues less operating expenses and
excludes depreciation, depletion and amortization, general and administrative
expenses, interest expense, interest income and income taxes.&#160; We have not 
reported asset information by
reportable segment because we do not produce such information 
internally.</font></font></p>
<p align="left" style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;page-break-
after:avoid;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman'">&nbsp;</font></font></p>

border-collapse:collapse;">

right:0in;margin-top:0in;text-indent:-10.0pt;">&nbsp;</p>
</td>
<td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="width:1.86%;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in">

<td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff"

</table>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold">&nbsp;</font></font></b></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold">NOTE
6.&#160; CONTINGENCY</font></font></b></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:
10.0pt">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<p style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New 
Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman'">In February 
2001, three
complaints were filed against MarkWest Hydrocarbon, Inc., in the Circuit Court
of Wayne County, West Virginia, by Columbia Gas Transmission Corporation and
Columbia Natural Resources, Inc.; Equitable Production Company and Equitable
Energy LLC; and Cobra Petroleum Company et al.&#160;
These complaints each allege breach of contract and seek various forms
of relief (including injunctive relief) and damages.&#160; Losses, if any, with 
regard to these complaints are
undeterminable.&#160; In July 2001, MarkWest
filed an action in the Denver District Court, Denver, Colorado, against
Columbia Gas Transmission Corporation and Columbia Natural Resources, Inc.;
Equitable Production Company and Equitable Energy, LLC; and Cobra Petroleum
Production Company et al, to compel arbitration on these matters in accordance
with provisions in existing contracts.&#160;
In August 2001, the Circuit Court of Wayne County, West Virginia, has
granted the plaintiff&#146;s motion for a temporary mandatory injunction 
requiring
MarkWest to return natural gas to producers in accordance with contractual
commitments.&#160; The ruling has no impact,
as MarkWest has continually returned natural gas in accordance with its
agreement.&#160; MarkWest has requested
reconsideration of certain aspects of the ruling.&#160; In addition, a trial 
date has been scheduled for February
2002.&#160; MarkWest is continuing settlement
negotiations with various parties.</font></font></p>
<p style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New 
Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New 
Roman'">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<h2 style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times
New Roman'">NOTE 7.&#160; ADOPTION OF SFAS NO. 133</font></font></b></h2>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:10.0pt">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:
10.0pt">MarkWest adopted SFAS&nbsp;No. 133, <i><font style="font-
style:italic">Accounting for Derivative Instruments and Hedging
Activities</font></i>, as amended, on January 1, 2001.&#160; In accordance with 
the transition provisions
of SFAS&nbsp;133, we recorded on that date a net-of-tax cumulative effect
adjustment of approximately $1.2 million loss to other comprehensive income to
recognize at fair value all derivatives that are designated as cash-flow
hedging instruments.</font></font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:
10.0pt">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:
10.0pt">SFAS 133 establishes accounting and reporting standards requiring
derivative instruments to be recorded in the balance sheet as either an asset
or liability measured at fair value.&#160;
Changes in the derivative instruments&#146; fair value are recognized in
earnings unless specific hedge accounting criteria are met.</font></font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:
10.0pt">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:
10.0pt">SFAS 133 allows hedge accounting for fair-value and cash-flow
hedges.&#160; A fair-value hedge applies to a
recognized asset or liability or an unrecognized firm commitment.&#160; A cash-
flow hedge applies to a forecasted
transaction or a variable cash flow of a recognized asset or liability.&#160; 
SFAS 133 provides that the gain or loss on a
derivative instrument designated and qualifying as a fair-value hedging
instrument as well as the offsetting loss or gain on the hedged item be
recognized currently in earnings in the same accounting period.&#160; SFAS 133 
provides that the effective portion
of the gain or loss on a derivative instrument designated and qualifying as a
cash-flow hedging instrument be reported as a component of other comprehensive
income and be reclassified into earnings in the same period during which the
hedged forecasted transaction affects earnings. (The remaining gain or loss on
the derivative instrument, if any, must be recognized currently in 
earnings.)&#160; Effectiveness is evaluated by the derivative
instrument&#146;s ability to generate offsetting changes in fair value or cash 
flows
to the hedged item.&#160; We formally
document, designate and assess the effectiveness of transactions receiving
hedge accounting treatment.</font></font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:
10.0pt">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:
10.0pt">In our gathering, processing and marketing segment, we enter into
fixed-price contracts for the sale of NGLs and fixed-price purchases for the
purchase of natural gas and NGLs.&#160; At
January 1, 2001, we recorded a risk management asset of approximately $2.1 
million
in the balance sheet with an offsetting amount recorded, less a deferred tax
liability of approximately $0.7 million, in other comprehensive
income&#151;approximately $1.3 million gain.&#160;
At September 30, 2001, the risk management liability was $2.2 million,
less $0.8 million deferred tax recovery, resulting in a $1.4 million loss in
other comprehensive income.&#160; We also
recorded a $0.4 million risk management liability and a corresponding risk
management asset to reflect our fair value hedges.</font></font></p>
<font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:
'Times New Roman';"><br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always">
</font></font>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:
10.0pt">In our exploration and production segment, MarkWest enters into
fixed-price contracts for the sale of natural gas.&#160; At January 1, 2001, we 
recorded a risk management liability of
approximately $3.9 million in the balance sheet with an offsetting amount
recorded, less a deferred tax recovery of approximately $1.4 million, in other
comprehensive income&#151;approximately $2.5 million loss.&#160; At September 
30, 2001, the risk management asset was $8.0
million, less $2.8 million deferred tax liability, resulting in a $5.2 million
gain in other comprehensive income.</font></font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:
10.0pt">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<p align="left" style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;text-
align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-
size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman'">During
the second quarter of 2001, we have entered into three year contracts to fix
interest rates on $10 million of our debt at 5.28% compared to a floating LIBOR
(in both cases, plus an applicable margin).&#160;
At September 30, 2001, we recorded a risk management liability of
approximately $0.4 million in the balance sheet with an offsetting amount
recorded, less a deferred tax recovery of approximately $0.1 million, resulting
in a $0.3 million loss in other comprehensive income.</font></font></p>
<p align="left" style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;text-
align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-
size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman'">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<p align="left" style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;text-
align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-
size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman'">Together,
at January 1, 2001, these amounts comprise the above net-of-tax cumulative
effect adjustment of approximately $1.2 million loss to other comprehensive
income.&#160; At September 30, 2001, with all
transactions considered, there is a $3.5 million gain to accumulated other
comprehensive income.</font></font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:
10.0pt">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><a name="Item2_ManagementsDiscussionAndAn"><b><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;font-
weight:bold">Item
2.&#160;&#160; Management&#146;s Discussion and
Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of 
Operations</font></font></b></a></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:
10.0pt">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<p align="left" style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;text-
align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-
size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman'">This
Management&#146;s Discussion and Analysis contains statements which, to the 
extent
that they are not recitations of historical fact, constitute &#147;forward-
looking
statements&#148; within the meaning of Section 27A of the Securities Act of 1933
(&#147;Section 27A&#148;) and Section 21E of the Securities and Exchange Act of 
1934 as
amended (&#147;Section 21E&#148;).&#160; This includes,
among other things, statements with respect to the outcome of the pending
litigation matters and contract negotiations.&#160;
All forward-looking statements involve risks and uncertainties.&#160; We intend 
that all forward-looking
statements in this document are subject to the safe harbor protection provided
by Sections 27A and 21E.&#160; Factors that
most typically impact MarkWest&#146;s operating results and financial condition
include:</font></font></p>
<p align="left" style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:.25in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;text-
align:left;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:12.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman'">&#149;</font></font><font
size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times
New Roman'">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; changes in general economic 
conditions in
regions where our products are located</font></font></p>
<p align="left" style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:.25in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;text-
align:left;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:12.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman'">&#149;</font></font><font
size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times
New Roman'">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; the availability and prices of NGL 
and
competing commodities</font></font></p>
<p align="left" style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:.25in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;text-
align:left;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:12.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman'">&#149;</font></font><font
size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times
New Roman'">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; the availability and prices of raw 
natural
gas supply</font></font></p>
<p align="left" style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:.25in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;text-
align:left;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:12.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman'">&#149;</font></font><font
size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times
New Roman'">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; our ability to negotiate favorable
marketing agreements</font></font></p>
<p align="left" style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:.25in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;text-
align:left;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:12.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman'">&#149;</font></font><font
size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times
New Roman'">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; the risks that third party or 
MarkWest&#146;s
natural gas exploration and production activities will not occur or be
successful</font></font></p>
<p align="left" style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:.25in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;text-
align:left;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:12.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman'">&#149;</font></font><font
size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times
New Roman'">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; our dependence on certain significant
customers, producers, gatherers, treaters and transporters of natural 
gas</font></font></p>
<p align="left" style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:.25in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;text-
align:left;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:12.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman'">&#149;</font></font><font
size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times
New Roman'">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; competition from other NGL 
processors,
including major energy companies</font></font></p>
<p align="left" style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:.25in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;text-
align:left;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:12.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman'">&#149;</font></font><font
size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times
New Roman'">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; our ability to identify and 
consummate
grass-roots projects or acquisitions complementary to our 
business</font></font></p>
<p align="left" style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:.25in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;text-
align:left;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:12.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman'">&#149;</font></font><font
size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times
New Roman'">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; winter weather 
conditions</font></font></p>
<p align="left" style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:.25in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;text-
align:left;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:12.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman'">&#149;</font></font><font
size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times
New Roman'">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; intermediate or final decisions in 
the
pending litigation and the relative positions of the parties in the negotiation
of new processing agreements</font></font></p>
<p align="left" style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:.25in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;text-
align:left;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:12.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman'">&#149;</font></font><font
size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times
New Roman'">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; changes in foreign economics, 
currency,
and laws and regulations in Canada where MarkWest has made direct 
investments</font></font></p>
<p align="left" style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:.25in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;text-
align:left;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:12.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman'">&#149;</font></font><font
size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times
New Roman'">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; our ability to integrate the recent
Canadian acquisition to operate an exploration and production company in
Canada, and to manage the Company as a more exploration and production focused
enterprise.</font></font></p>
<p align="left" style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;text-
align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-
size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman'">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<p align="left" style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;text-
align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-
size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman'">In
addition, there are certain factors that impact MarkWest&#146;s exploration and
production segment.&#160; These include
uncertainties inherent in estimating quantities of proven oil and gas reserves,
projecting rates of production and timing of development expenditures.&#160; The
drilling of wells can involve
significant risks including those related to timing, success rates and cost
overruns.&#160; Rig availability, complex
geology and other factors can affect these risks.&#160; Future gas and oil 
prices also could affect results of operations
and cash flows.</font></font></p>
<p align="left" style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;text-
align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-
size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman'">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<p align="left" style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;text-
align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-
size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman'">Forward-looking
statements involve many uncertainties that are beyond our ability to
control.&#160; In many cases, we cannot
predict what factors would cause actual results to differ materially from those
indicated by the forward-looking statements.</font></font></p>
<p align="left" style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;text-
align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-
size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman'">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:
'Times New Roman';"><br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always">
</font></font>
<p align="left" style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;text-
align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-
size:10.0pt;
font-family:'Times New Roman';font-weight:bold">Operating 
data</font></font></b></p>

style="font-size:10.0pt">$</font></font></p>
</td>
<td width="16%" valign="bottom" style="width:16.28%;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in">
<p align="right" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;text-align:right;"><font size="2"
face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt">(0.18</font></font></p>
</td>
<td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="width:1.02%;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in">
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:10.0pt">)</font></font></p>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New
Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<p align="left" style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;text-
align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-
size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman'">The
strongest demand for propane, and consequently the highest volumes of and
margins for propane sales, generally occur in the winter heating season.&#160; 
Therefore, a substantial portion of our net
income is recognized in the first and fourth quarters.&#160; This seasonality 
occurs in the GPM segment
of our business.</font></font></p>
<p align="left" style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;text-
align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-
size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman'">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<p align="left" style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;text-
align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-
size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman'">For
the quarter ended September 30, 2001, we report a net loss of $0.2 million, or
$0.02 per share, compared to net income, of $1.3 million, or $0.16 per share,
for the same period last year.&#160; Earnings
before interest, taxes and depreciation, depletion and amortization 
(&#147;EBITDA&#148;)
was $3.6 million versus $4.3 million in the third quarter of 2001 and 2000,
respectively.</font></font></p>
<p align="left" style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;text-
align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-
size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman'">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<p align="left" style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;text-
align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-
size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman'">The
GPM segment&#146;s cash operating income was down $3.2 million compared to
2000.&#160; MarkWest&#146;s Appalachian operations
experienced a lower spread between the price of the NGLs versus the cost of the
natural gas than in the previous year, when the margin was significantly above
average.&#160; The margin was $0.10 per
gallon versus $0.20 per gallon, or $2.7 million less margin in third quarter
2001.&#160; Sales volumes were 26.5 million
gallons versus 29.9 million gallons, down 11 percent from third quarter 2000 to
2001.&#160; This unfavorable volume variance
translates to $0.7 million less margin in third quarter 2001.&#160; The decline 
was due to delays of additional
third-party compression facilities and gathering pipeline relocations.&#160; 
Natural gas marketing revenues are $19.2
million less than last year.&#160; This
decrease had a negligible affect on overall results of the GPM segment.&#160; 
Natural gas marketing activities are low
margin transactions done in support of our processing business.&#160; The 
E&amp;P segment&#146;s cash operating income
was $2.2 million ahead of last year due to the Canadian acquisition and in the
Rocky Mountain E&amp;P business segment, higher volume and prices as well as
the San Juan property acquired earlier this year, improved 2001 results.&#160; 
Depreciation, depletion and amortization
were up $1.9 million due to the Canadian acquisition and other company 
growth.</font></font></p>
<p align="left" style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;text-
align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-
size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman'">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:
'Times New Roman';"><br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always">
</font></font>
<p align="left" style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;text-
align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-
size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman';
font-weight:bold">Nine Months Ended September 30, 2001, Compared to the Nine
Months Ended September 30, 2000 (in 000s)</font></font></b></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" face="Times

font-weight:bold">&nbsp;</font></font></b></p>

</table>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:
10.0pt">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<h1 align="left" style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;font-
style:italic;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-
top:0in;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" 
face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;
font-family:'Times New Roman';font-weight:normal;font-style:normal">For the
nine months ended September 30, 2001, we report net income of $1.3 million, or
$0.15 per share, compared to net income, excluding gain on sale, of $5.1
million, or $0.60 per share, for the same period last year.&#160; Earnings 
before interest, taxes and
depreciation, depletion and amortization (&#147;EBITDA&#148;) was $10.5 million 
versus
$14.7 million in 2001 and 2000, respectively.</font></font></i></b></h1>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:
10.0pt">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<p align="left" style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;text-
align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-
size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman'">The
GPM segment&#146;s cash operating income was down $8.9 million compared to
2000.&#160; MarkWest&#146;s Appalachian operations
experienced a lower spread between the price of the NGLs versus the cost of the
natural gas than in the previous year when the margin was significantly above
average.&#160; The margin was $0.14 versus
$0.21, a difference of $0.07 per gallon, or $5.6 million less margin in
2001.&#160; The $0.14 margin per gallon
earned in 2001 is slightly below the ten year average of $0.16 margin per
gallon.&#160; Natural gas marketing revenues
are $0.2 million less than last year.&#160;
This decrease had a negligible affect on overall results of the GPM
segment.&#160; Natural gas marketing
activities are low margin transactions done is support of our processing
business.&#160;&#160;&#160; The E&amp;P segment was
$5.1 million ahead of last year due to the Canadian acquisition and in the
Rocky Mountain E&amp;P business unit, higher volume and prices, as well as the
additional San Juan properties acquired earlier this year improved 2001
results.&#160; Operating expenses as well as
the general and administrative costs were higher in 2001 than the same period
last year primarily due to the Canadian acquisition and increases related to
the capital expansions and acquisitions since last year.&#160; Depreciation, 
depletion and amortization
were up $2.4 million due to the Canadian acquisition and other company 
growth.</font></font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:
10.0pt">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<h1 align="left" style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;font-
style:italic;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-
top:0in;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" 
face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New 
Roman';
font-style:normal">Gathering, Processing and Marketing&#160; 
(GPM)</font></font></i></b></h1>
<h1 align="left" style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;font-
style:italic;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-
top:0in;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><b><i><font size="2" 
face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New 
Roman'">&nbsp;</font></font></i></b></h1>
<p align="left" style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;text-
align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-
size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman'">We
are paid for our processing in Appalachia through sales of liquids extracted
and fees for units of throughput.&#160; A
large portion, about 65 percent, of our processing services for gas producers
in Appalachia involves extracting NGLs from inlet gas streams and replacing the
equivalent heat content with dry natural gas purchased in the spot or forward
market.&#160;&#160; Consequently, this segment of
our business depends on a positive spread between the NGL prices and the cost
of the replacement natural gas (&#147;processing 
margin&#148;).</font></font></p>
<p align="left" style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;text-
align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-
size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman'">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<p align="left" style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;text-
align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-
size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman'">The
cash operating income for the GPM segment was $2.9 million for the third
quarter and $10.8 million year to date for 2001.&#160; This compares with $6.2 
million and $19.7 million respectively
for the year 2000.&#160; The expansion of the
Kenova plant is complete, but disappointing throughput in the Appalachian
system was largely due to lack of adequate compressor capabilities of third
parties supplying natural gas from the wellhead to our processing plants and
gathering pipeline relocations.</font></font></p>
<p align="left" style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;text-
align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-
size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman'">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:
10.0pt">A lower frac spread between the price of the NGL&#146;s verses the cost 
of
the natural gas negatively impacted our gross margin in Appalachia.&#160; 2000 
margins were significantly above
average.&#160; The unfavorable price variance
in the third quarter was $2.6 million.&#160;
Volumes sold at our Siloam fractionator during the third quarter are 11
percent lower than the same quarter last year, but on a year-to-date basis; the
volume variance is negligible, less than 3 percent.&#160; The volumes were lower
for the reason stated above.</font></font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:
10.0pt">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<p style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New 
Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman'">Earlier in 
the year
2001, there was a dramatic decline in the prices of NGLs that triggered a write
down of inventory value at our Appalachia propane terminals negatively
impacting the Appalachian gross margins in 2001.</font></font></p>
<p style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New 
Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New 
Roman'">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:
'Times New Roman';"><br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always">
</font></font>
<p style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="1" face="Times New 
Roman"><font style="font-size:9.0pt;font-family:'Times New 
Roman'">I</font></font><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-
size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman'">n western Michigan,
volumes were up modestly, but should trend up in the fourth quarter and even
more in the first quarter of 2002.&#160; As
many as six additional, largely third party, wells are expected to be connected
to the system by year-end which should double the throughput rate to 20,000
Mcfd as we enter the new year.</font></font></p>
<p style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New 
Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New 
Roman'">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<h3 align="left" style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;page-break-
after:avoid;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman'">Exploration
and Production (E &amp; P)</font></font></b></h3>
<p style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New
Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New 
Roman'">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:
10.0pt">Cash operating income for MarkWest&#146;s E&amp;P businesses increased 
to
$2.6 million for the third quarter and $6.1 million year-to-date 2001.&#160; 
This compares favorably with the $0.4
million for the third quarter of 2000 and $1.0 million for year-to-date
2000.&#160; High natural gas prices,
acquisitions, new projects in eastern Michigan and benefits of our prior year
capital investments have all favorably impacted the operating income for this
segment.</font></font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:
10.0pt">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:
10.0pt">This large increase is due to a 77 percent increase in production
volume in the San Juan basin properties and production from the $50 million
acquisition of the Canadian units included for the first time.&#160; Canadian 
production included only the last
two months of the quarter.&#160; Both units
are in significant exploitation modes with a multi-year inventory of drillable
locations.&#160; The success of the third
quarter exploration program added between 5 and 6 Bcfe of additional 
reserves.&#160;&#160; Approximately 20 wells were awaiting
connection at quarter&#146;s end and should be flowing late fourth quarter and 
early
first quarter 2002.</font></font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font
style="font-size:
10.0pt">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:
10.0pt">In eastern Michigan, the Au Gres project continues to grow with the
addition of a second well and plans for a third recompletion are nearly
complete.</font></font></p>
<p style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;font-style:italic;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;page-break-
after:avoid;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-
size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman'">&nbsp;</font></font></i></p>
<p style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;font-style:italic;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;page-break-
after:avoid;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-
size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman';
font-weight:bold;font-style:normal">Revenues and 
Expenses</font></font></i></b></p>
<p style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New 
Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New 
Roman'">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<p style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New 
Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman';
font-style:italic">Revenues</font></font></i></p>
<p style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New 
Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman'">Revenues 
increased from
$142.6 million to $151.5 million year-to-date 2000 compared to 2001.&#160; 
During the third quarter, the revenues are
$24.9 million lower in 2001 compared to 2000.</font></font></p>
<p style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New
Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New 
Roman'">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<p style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New 
Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman'">Gas 
marketing activities
are low margin transactions done in support of our processing business.&#160; 
The volume and gross margins have decreased
this year.&#160;&#160; The 2001 year-to-date gas
marketing revenues are $0.2 million behind last year at the same time, and third
quarter 2001 revenues are $19.2 million behind third quarter 2000
revenues.&#160; However, this low margin
activity impacted operating profit only negligibly.</font></font></p>
<p style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New 
Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New 
Roman'">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<p style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New 
Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman'">Our GPM 
segment,
excluding gas marketing activities previously mentioned, had revenues of $21.4
million and $29.7 million for the third quarter 2001 and 2000; however,
year-to-date 2001 revenues are still ahead of prior year by $3.2 million.&#160; 
The quarterly decrease is predominately in
the Appalachian NGL sales price.&#160; The
prices decreased from $0.63 per gallon to $0.46 per gallon in 2001.&#160; NGL 
sales volumes were also down for the
third quarter 2001 compared to 2000 by 4.6 million gallons.&#160; These price 
and volume decreases translate
to $9.1 million less revenue for the third quarter 2001.</font></font></p>
<p style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New 
Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New 
Roman'">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<p style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New 
Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman'">Our E&amp;P 
segment
contributed an additional $5.8 million to year-to-date revenues, with $2.6
million of that in the third quarter of 2001.&#160;
The additional revenue is the result of the AuGres project coming on
line in July 2000, high natural gas prices, and the benefits of last year&#146;s
capital expenditures.&#160; We also had
higher volumes due to an acquisition earlier this year and the addition of
Canadian production beginning in August 2001.</font></font></p>
<p style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New 
Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New 
Roman'">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<p style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New 
Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman';
font-style:italic">Cost of Sales</font></font></i></p>
<p style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New 
Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman'">Cost of 
sales increased
from $109.6 million to $120.6 million year-to-date 2000 compared to 2001.&#160; 
During the third quarter, cost of sales are
$24.4 million lower in 2001 compared to 2000.</font></font></p>
<p style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New 
Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New 
Roman'">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<p style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New 
Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman'">Gas 
marketing cost of
sales, like revenues, are down $19.4 million in third quarter 2001 compared to
2000, and are down $0.9 million year-to-date.&#160;
This low margin activity impacted operating profit only
negligibly.</font></font></p>
<p style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New 
Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New 
Roman'">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:
10.0pt">Our GPM segment cost of sales are $12.3 million higher year-to-date
2001 compared to 2000.&#160; The predominant
cause of this increase is related to the feedstock cost increase.&#160; In 2000,
the cost per gallon was $0.38
versus a cost of $0.45 for 2001.</font></font></p>
<p style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New 
Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New 
Roman'">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<p style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New 
Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman';
font-style:italic">Operating Expenses</font></font></i></p>
<p style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New 
Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman'">Operating 
expenses
increased $1.7 million or 14% for the nine months ended September 30, 2001
compared to the same period last year.&#160;
The third quarter&#146;s operating expenses increased $0.6 or 14% from 2000
to 2001.&#160; Much of the increased costs
year-to-date relate to the acquisitions and expansions from 2000 being on line
for all of 2001 as opposed to only part of 2000, as well as higher fuel costs
in 2001.&#160; The third quarter&#146;s increased
costs are almost entirely attributable to the Canadian 
acquisition</font></font></p>
<p style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New 
Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New 
Roman'">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:
'Times New Roman';"><br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always">
</font></font>
<p style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New 
Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman';
font-style:italic">General and Administrative Expenses</font></font></i></p>
<p style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New 
Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman'">General and
administrative expenses were $6.2 and $6.0 million year-to-date 2001 and 2000,
respectively.&#160; General and
administrative expenses were $1.9 and $2.2 for the third quarter 2001 and 2000,
respectively.&#160; The third quarter
decrease is due to capitalization of overhead costs for construction projects
and general cost cutting, partially offset by the new Canadian unit and legal 
expenses.</font></font></p>
<p style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New 
Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New 
Roman'">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<p style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New 
Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman';
font-style:italic">Depreciation, Depletion and 
Amortization</font></font></i></p>
<p style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New 
Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New 
Roman'">Depreciation, depletion
and amortization increased significantly year-to-date ($2.4 million) and for
the third quarter ($1.9 million) 2001 compared to 2000.&#160; The increase is 
primarily related to oil and
gas properties of $82.1 million acquired in the Canadian acquisition.&#160; A 
portion of the additional depletion is
being recovered with a deferred tax benefit related to the step-up in basis of
Canadian assets.&#160; In addition, there
were significant capital expenditures made in 2000 and early in 
2001.</font></font></p>
<p style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New 
Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New 
Roman'">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<p style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New 
Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman';
font-style:italic">Other income and expense</font></font></i></p>
<p style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New 
Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman'">During the 
second
quarter 2000, we sold an asset for a $1.0 million pre-tax 
gain.</font></font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:
10.0pt">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<h3 align="left" style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;page-break-
after:avoid;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman'">Liquidity
and Capital Resources</font></font></b></h3>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New
Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<p align="left" style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;page-break-
after:avoid;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman'">MarkWest&#146;s
sources of liquidity and capital resources historically have been internal cash
flow and our revolving line of credit.&#160;
In the first quarter of 2000, we supplemented these sources with
proceeds from the sale of our corporate office building.&#160; In the second 
quarter of 2000, we increased
our line of credit by $15 million to $65 million.&#160; In the third quarter of 
2001, we increased our credit line
further to $130 million.</font></font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:
10.0pt">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<p align="left" style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;page-break-
after:avoid;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman'">The
following summary table reflects our comparative cash flows for the nine months
ended September 30, 2001 and 2000 (in thousands):</font></font></p>
<p align="left" style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;page-break-
after:avoid;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman'">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<table width="100%" style="width:100.0%;
border-collapse:collapse;">
<tr>
