</table>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:
10.0pt">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<h6 align="left" style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;font-
style:italic;font-weight:normal;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><i><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times
New Roman'">Capital
Investment Program</font></font></i></h6>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:10.0pt">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:10.0pt">MarkWest forecasts a
baseline capital budget of $28&nbsp;million in 2001 in addition to our $50
million acquisition.&#160; In our gathering,
processing and marketing segment the 2001 capital budget includes $8 million
for completion of Appalachia&#146;s Phase II expansion and up to $5 million for 
new
infrastructure to serve our recently acquired Canadian properties.&#160; The 
2001 capital budget also includes $13
million for our exploration and production segment&#151;$5 million for the
acquisition of San Juan Basin properties in January 2001; $2 million for infill
drilling in the San Juan Basin; $2 million in Michigan; and $4 million for our
new Canadian properties.&#160; In addition,
MarkWest spent $50 million for the Canadian acquisition.</font></font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:10.0pt">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic">Financing 
Facilities</font></font></i></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:10.0pt">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<p style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New 
Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman'">Financing
activities consist primarily of net borrowings under MarkWest&#146;s credit
facilities.&#160; At September 30, 2001, we
had $130 million of available credit, of which we had utilized $98.6
million.&#160; Depending on the timing and
amount of our capital projects, we may have to seek additional sources of
capital.&#160; While we believe that we will
be able to secure additional financing on acceptable terms, if required, we
have no assurance that we will be able to do so.</font></font></p>
<p style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New 
Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New 
Roman'">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<h2 style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times
New Roman'">Commodity Price Risk
Management</font></font></b></h2>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New
Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<p style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2"
face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New 
Roman'">MarkWest&#146;s
primary risk management objective is to reduce volatility in our cash
flows.&#160; Our hedging approach uses a
statistical method that analyzes momentum and average pricing over time and
various fundamental data, such as industry inventories, industry production,
demand and weather.&#160; Hedging levels
increase with capital commitments and debt levels and when above-average margins
exist.&#160; We maintain a committee,
including members of senior management, which oversees all hedging 
activity.</font></font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:-.25pt;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:10.0pt">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:10.0pt">We achieve our goals
utilizing a combination of fixed-price forward contracts and fixed-for-float
price swaps on the over-the&#150;counter (&#147;OTC&#148;) market.&#160; New 
York Mercantile Exchange
(&#147;NYMEX&#148;)-traded futures are authorized for use, but only occasionally
used.&#160; Swaps and futures allow us to
protect margins, because gains or losses in the physical market are generally
offset by corresponding losses or gains in the value of financial 
instruments.</font></font></p>
<font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:
'Times New Roman';"><br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always">
</font></font>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;">&nbsp;</p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:10.0pt">We enter OTC swaps with
counterparties that are primarily of other energy companies.&#160; We conduct a 
standard credit review and have
agreements with such parties that contain collateral requirements.&#160; We use 
standardized swap agreements that
allow for offset of positive and negative exposures.&#160; Net credit exposure 
is marked to market daily.&#160; We are subject to margin deposit requirements
under OTC agreements (and NYMEX positions).</font></font></p>
<p align="left" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;text-align:left;"><font size="2" 
face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<p align="left" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;text-align:left;"><font size="2" 
face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt">The use of financial 
instruments may expose MarkWest
to the risk of financial loss in certain circumstances, including instances
when (a) sales volumes are less than expected, requiring market purchases to
meet commitments; or (b) our OTC counterparties fail to purchase or deliver the
contracted quantities of natural gas, NGLs, or crude oil, or otherwise fail to
perform.&#160; To the extent that we engage
in hedging activities, we may be prevented from realizing the benefits of
favorable price changes in the physical market.&#160; However, we are similarly 
insulated against decreases in such
prices.</font></font></p>
<p align="left" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;text-align:left;"><font size="2" 
face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<p align="left" style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;text-
align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-
size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman'">MarkWest
hedges our basis risk for natural gas, but we are generally unable to do so for
NGLs.&#160; Our basis risk stems from the
geographic price differentials between our sales locations and hedging contract
delivery locations.&#160; Basis risk is the
risk that an adverse change in the hedging market will not be completely offset
by an equal and opposite change in the price of the physical commodity being
hedged.</font></font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:10.0pt">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<p align="left" style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;text-
align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-
size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman'">In
our gathering, processing and marketing segment, we hedge Appalachia processing
margins by using a combination of methods.&#160;
We protect margins by purchasing natural gas priced on predetermined Btu
differentials to propane or crude, by simultaneously selling propane or crude
oil and purchasing natural gas, and by using swaps.&#160; Crude oil is highly 
correlated with certain NGL products.&#160; All projected margins on open 
positions
assume the basis differentials between crude oil, and NGLs are consistent with
historical averages.&#160; As of September
30, 2001, we have hedged NGL volumes and associated projected margin per NGL
gallon, as follows:</font></font></p>
<p align="left" style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;text-
align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-
size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman'">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<table width="100%" style="width:100.0%;
border-collapse:collapse;">

<td width="17" style="border:none"></td>
<td width="8" style="border:none"></td>

<td width="120" style="border:none"></td>

</table>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:10.0pt">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:10.0pt">For certain Appalachia
natural gas liquid purchases, as of September 30, 2001, we have hedged 0.7
million and 1.1&nbsp;million gallons at $0.54 per gallon for fourth quarter
2001 and first quarter 2002, respectively.&#160;
For certain Appalachia natural gas sales, as of September 30, 2001, we
have hedged 206,000 and 444,000 MMBtu at $5.19 per MMBtu for 2001 and 2002,
respectively.</font></font></p>
<p align="left" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;text-align:left;"><font size="2" 
face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<p align="left" style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;text-
align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-
size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman'">In
addition to these risk management tools, MarkWest utilizes our NGL storage
facilities and contracts for third-party storage to build product inventories
during historically lower-priced periods for resale during higher-priced 
periods.&#160; We also have contracts to purchase certain
quantities of our natural gas feedstock in advance of physical 
needs.</font></font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:10.0pt">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<p align="left" style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;text-
align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-
size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman'">In
our exploration and production segment, we hedge our exposure to changes in
market prices for our natural gas production.&#160;
As of September 30, 2001, we had hedged natural gas volumes and prices
as follows:</font></font></p>
<p align="left" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;text-align:left;"><font size="2" 
face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt">&nbsp;</font></font></p>

border-collapse:collapse;">

<p align="right" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;text-align:right;"><font size="2" 
face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt">3.68</font></font></p>
</td>
<td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="width:1.6%;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in">
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;">&nbsp;</p>
</td>
<td width="0%" valign="bottom" style="width:.92%;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in">
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:10.0pt">$</font></font></p>
</td>
<td width="8%" valign="bottom" style="width:8.12%;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in">
<p align="right" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;text-align:right;"><font size="2" 
face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt">3.57</font></font></p>
</td>
<td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="width:1.6%;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in">
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;">&nbsp;</p>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:10.0pt">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New 
Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;color:black;layout-grid-mode:
line">As a result of the Canadian E&amp;P acquisition, we are transitioning our
hedging strategy to recognize the natural hedge between our E&amp;P production
and our natural gas purchase requirements in our Appalachian GPM business.&#160;
Going forward, we anticipate hedging NGL
sales and net gas sales (i.e. the excess of production over 
purchases).</font></font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:10.0pt">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New 
Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;color:black;layout-grid-mode:
line">MarkWest&#146;s hedging strategy benefited our after-tax earnings compared
to
the situation of not hedging.&#160; In the
gathering, processing and marketing segment, without hedging, net income would
have been lower by $0 million and $1.2 million for the three and nine months
ended September 30, 2001.&#160; For
comparison, net income would have been higher by $0.7 million and $1.6 million
for the three and nine months ended September 30, 2000.&#160; This impact 
considers only hedges of
Appalachia processing margin and does not reflect other decisions made
concerning when to buy natural gas or store NGL production for sale in later
months.&#160; In the exploration and
production segment, without hedging, net income would have been lower by $0.4
million and higher by $0.4 million for the three and 
nine</font></font>&nbsp;months<font color="black"><font 
style="color:black;layout-grid-mode:line"> ended September
30, 2001.&#160; For comparison, net income
would have been higher by $0.2 million and $0.3 million for the three and nine
months ended September 30, 2000.</font></font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:10.0pt">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<p align="left" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;text-align:left;"><font size="2" 
face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt">We enter into speculative
transactions on an infrequent basis.&#160;
Specific approval by the Board of Directors is necessary prior to
executing such transactions.&#160;
Speculative transactions are marked to market at the end of each
accounting period, and any gain or loss is recognized in income for that
period.&#160; There were no such speculative
activities for the quarters ended September 30, 2001 and 2000.</font></font></p>
<p align="left" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;text-align:left;"><font size="2" 
face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:
'Times New Roman';"><br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always">
</font></font>
<p align="left" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" 
face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;font-
weight:bold">Outlook</font></font></b></p>
<p style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;font-style:italic;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;page-break-
after:avoid;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-
size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman'">&nbsp;</font></font></i></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font
style="font-size:
10.0pt">In the Appalachian GPM segment, the expansion of the Kenova gas plant
is complete and on line.&#160; This completes
the Phase II expansion program which also involved the building of a new plant
near the existing Kenova plant.&#160; NGL
production is ramping up to 170 million gallons in 2002 compared to the
anticipated 145 million gallons in 2001 from these new and expanded
facilities.&#160; Planning for other new
projects is also underway.</font></font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:
10.0pt">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:
10.0pt">In the Michigan GPM segment, the two new discoveries made with industry
partners earlier this year and a newly contracted third party well will start
to flow late in the fourth quarter of this year.&#160; Other third party wells 
that have not been flowing due to a third
party title dispute started flowing in the third quarter.&#160; By early 2002, 
the throughput volumes should
be 15,000 to 20,000 Mcfd.</font></font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:
10.0pt">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:
10.0pt">In the Exploration and Production segment, the company expects natural
gas production to average 35,000 Mcfed in 2002 compared to the anticipated
13,000 Mcfed in 2001.&#160; Over 50
exploitation wells are planned in Canada and the United States.&#160; This 2002 
production level is approximately
the same as natural gas shrinkage needs for our midstream business and
constitutes a natural hedge, which should mitigate future earnings 
volatility.</font></font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:
10.0pt">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:
10.0pt">EBITDA for the year 2002 is expected to be about $40 million, with the
assumption that natural gas averages $3.00 per MMBtu at Henry Hub and West
Texas Intermediate oil averages $21.00 per barrel.&#160; NGL pricing has a very 
high correlation to crude oil pricing.&#160; The 2001 EBITDA is expected to be 
about $20
million.</font></font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:
10.0pt">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:
10.0pt">Pending new projects, capital expenditures for the Gas Processing and
Marketing segment are expected to be nominal for 2002 compared with an
anticipated level of $13 million in 2001.&#160;
The Exploration and Production segment plans expenditures of about $20
million compared with $13 million in 2001 (not including the $50 million
Canadian acquisition).&#160;&#160;&#160; These are
split about two-thirds to Canada and one-third to the U.S.</font></font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font
style="font-size:
10.0pt">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><a name="Item3_QuantitativeAndQualitativeDi"><b><font
size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;font-
weight:bold">Item
3.&#160; Quantitative and Qualitative
Disclosures about Market Risk</font></font></b></a></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:
10.0pt">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<p style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New 
Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman'">Reference is
made to
Commodity Price Risk Management in Item 2 of this Form 10-Q.</font></font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:
10.0pt">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<h3 align="left" style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;page-break-
after:avoid;text-align:left;"><a name="PartIi_OtherInformation"><b><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times
New Roman'">PART II.&#160;&#160; OTHER INFORMATION</font></font></b></a></h3>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New
Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;page-break-after:avoid;"><a 
name="Item1_LegalProceedings"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold">Item
1.&#160; Legal Proceedings</font></font></b></a></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New
Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<p style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
left:.5in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;text-indent:-.25in;"><sup><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;
font-family:'Times New Roman'">(a)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; 
</font></font></sup><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-
size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman'">As
we reported in a current report on Form 8-K, dated February 22, 2001, three
complaints have been filed against us in the Circuit Court of Wayne County,
West Virginia, by Columbia Gas Transmission Corporation and Columbia Natural
Resources, Inc.; Equitable Production Company and Equitable Energy, LLC; and
Cobra Petroleum Production Company et al.&#160;
These complaints each allege breach of contract and seek various forms
of relief (including injunctive relief) and damages.</font></font></p>
<p style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
left:.25in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New 
Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New 
Roman'">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<p style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
left:.5in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New 
Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman'">In
July 2001, MarkWest has filed an action in the Denver District Court, in
Denver, Colorado, against Columbia Gas Transmission Corporation and Columbia
Natural Resources, Inc.; Equitable Production Company and Equitable Energy,
LLC; and Cobra Petroleum Production Company et al to compel arbitration on
these matters in accordance with provisions in existing contracts.&#160; In 
August 2001, the Circuit Court of Wayne
County, West Virginia, granted the plaintiff&#146;s motion for a temporary 
mandatory
injunction requiring MarkWest to return natural gas to producers in accordance
with contractual commitments.&#160; The
ruling has no impact, as MarkWest has continually returned natural gas in
accordance with its agreement.&#160; MarkWest
has requested reconsideration of certain aspects of the ruling.&#160; In 
addition, a trial date has been scheduled
for February 2002.&#160; MarkWest is
continuing settlement negotiations with various parties.</font></font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:
10.0pt">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<p align="left" style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:.5in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;text-
align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-
size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman'">In
the winter of 2000-2001, current and futures prices for natural gas had risen
dramatically relative to prices for NGLs (propane, butane, etc.).&#160; A large 
portion&#151;about 75 percent&#151;of
MarkWest&#146;s processing services for gas producers in Appalachia involves 
extracting
NGLs from inlet gas streams and replacing the equivalent heat content with dry
natural gas purchased in the spot or forward markets.&#160; This part of our 
operating margin depends on a positive spread
between NGL prices and natural gas costs.&#160;
Effective February 1, 2001, we provided producers with an alternative
processing contract that provides for additional compensation to MarkWest when
processing margins are low and reduced compensation when these margins are
high.&#160; To date, over 90 producers (accounting
for a minority share of the volume) have agreed to an amended contract.&#160; If
producers elect to remain with the
existing contract, we have stated that we will return the replacement natural
gas at a later date.&#160; We believe this is
permitted under the existing contract such that we can earn a reasonable fee
for our services.</font></font></p>
<p align="left" style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:.5in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;text-
align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-
size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman'">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:
'Times New Roman';"><br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always">
</font></font>
<p align="left" style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:.5in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;text-
align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-
size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman'">Since
the winter of 2000-2001, the relationship between NGLs and natural gas has
improved substantially.</font></font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New
Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:.5in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-.25in;"><sup><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-
size:10.0pt">(b)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font></font></sup>On
June 6, 2001, Level Propane Gases, Inc. filed suit against MarkWest
Hydrocarbon, Inc. in the Court of Common Pleas, Cuyahoga County, Ohio alleging
breach of contract for failure to furnish a specified quantity of gallons of
propane gas on a monthly basis from May 1, 2000 to April 30, 2001, and seeking
direct and punitive damages.</p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New
Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<p align="left" style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:.5in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;page-break-
after:avoid;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman'">On
July 25, 2001, MarkWest filed a Motion to stay proceedings pending arbitration
in Denver, Colorado in the Court of Common Pleas, Cuyahoga County, 
Ohio.</font></font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New
Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:.25in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:.25in;"><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt">MarkWest
believes Level&#146;s breach of contract claim has no merit.</font></font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:
10.0pt">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><a name="Item6_ExhibitsAndReportsOnForm8"><b><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;font-
weight:bold">Item
6.&#160; Exhibits and Reports on Form 8-K</font></font></b></a></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:
10.0pt">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:.25in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New 
Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt">(a) &#160; Exhibits</font></font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:.9in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;text-indent:-.4in;"><font size="2" face="Times New 
Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt">11 &#151; Statement regarding
computation of earnings per share.</font></font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-left:0in;margin-
right:0in;margin-top:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:10.0pt">&nbsp;</font></font></p>
<h2 style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
left:.25in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;page-break-after:avoid;text-
indent:-.25in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-
size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman';
font-weight:normal">(b) &#160; Reports on Form
8-K</font></font></b></h2>
<h2 style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
left:.5in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;
font-family:'Times New Roman';font-
weight:normal">(i)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#
160; A report on Form 8-K was filed on August 14, 2001,
announcing the acquisition of two Canadian</font></font></b></h2>
<h2 style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
left:.5in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;
font-family:'Times New Roman';font-
weight:normal">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160
;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; natural gas production 
companies.</font></font></b></h2>
<h2 style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
left:.5in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;
font-family:'Times New Roman';font-
weight:normal">(ii)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; 
A report on Form 8-K was filed August 27, 2001, presenting
the purchase and sale and financing</font></font></b></h2>
<h2 style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
left:.5in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;
font-family:'Times New Roman';font-
weight:normal">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160
;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; agreements on the acquisition of the two Canadian
companies announced on August 14, 2001.</font></font></b></h2>
<h2 style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
left:.5in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;
font-family:'Times New Roman';font-
weight:normal">(iii)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; A 
report on Form 8K/A was filed on October 24, 2001, presenting
audited financial statements of the</font></font></b></h2>
<h2 style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
left:.5in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font
size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;
font-family:'Times New Roman';font-
weight:normal">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160
;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; two Canadian companies acquired in August 2001 and
pro forma financials for MarkWest.</font></font></b></h2>
<h2 style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
left:.5in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;
font-family:'Times New Roman';font-weight:normal">&nbsp;</font></font></b></h2>
<font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:
'Times New Roman';"><br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always">
</font></font>
<h2 style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
left:.5in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;page-break-after:avoid;"><a 
name="Signature"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-
size:10.0pt;
font-family:'Times New Roman'">SIGNATURE</font></font></b></a></h2>
<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
left:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-top:0in;text-align:center;"><font size="2" 
face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt">&nbsp;</font></font></p>

Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:'Times New Roman'">Pursuant to 
the
requirements of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, MarkWest, as registrant,
had this report signed on our behalf by the undersigned, who has been duly
authorized.</font></font></p>
